trans-unit.source: How to use Blob storage from Ruby | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to use Blob storage from Ruby | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the Azure Blob service to upload, download, list, and delete blob content. Samples written in Ruby.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the Azure Blob service to upload, download, list, and delete blob content. Samples written in Ruby.

trans-unit.source: This guide will show you how to perform common scenarios using the Azure Blob service.
trans-unit.target: This guide will show you how to perform common scenarios using the Azure Blob service.

trans-unit.source: The samples are written using the Ruby API.
trans-unit.target: The samples are written using the Ruby API.

trans-unit.source: The scenarios covered include uploading, listing, downloading, and deleting blobs.
trans-unit.target: The scenarios covered include uploading, listing, downloading, and deleting blobs.

trans-unit.source: Create a Ruby application.
trans-unit.target: Create a Ruby application.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see <linkText>Create a Ruby application on Azure</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see <linkText>Create a Ruby application on Azure</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To use Azure Storage, you need to download and use the Ruby azure package, which includes a set of convenience libraries that communicate with the storage REST services.
trans-unit.target: To use Azure Storage, you need to download and use the Ruby azure package, which includes a set of convenience libraries that communicate with the storage REST services.

trans-unit.source: Use a command-line interface such as PowerShell (Windows), Terminal (Mac), or Bash (Unix).
trans-unit.target: Use a command-line interface such as PowerShell (Windows), Terminal (Mac), or Bash (Unix).

trans-unit.source: Type "gem install azure" in the command window to install the gem and dependencies.
trans-unit.target: Type "gem install azure" in the command window to install the gem and dependencies.

trans-unit.source: Using your favorite text editor, add the following to the top of the Ruby file where you intend to use storage:
trans-unit.target: Using your favorite text editor, add the following to the top of the Ruby file where you intend to use storage:

trans-unit.source: The azure module will read the environment variables AZURE\_STORAGE\_ACCOUNT and AZURE\_STORAGE\_ACCESS_KEY for information required to connect to your Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: The azure module will read the environment variables AZURE\_STORAGE\_ACCOUNT and AZURE\_STORAGE\_ACCESS_KEY for information required to connect to your Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: If these environment variables are not set, you must specify the account information before using Azure::BlobService with the following code:
trans-unit.target: If these environment variables are not set, you must specify the account information before using Azure::BlobService with the following code:

trans-unit.source: To obtain these values:
trans-unit.target: To obtain these values:

trans-unit.source: Log in to the <linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Log in to the <linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the storage account you want to use.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the storage account you want to use.

trans-unit.source: Click MANAGE KEYS at the bottom of the navigation pane.
trans-unit.target: Click MANAGE KEYS at the bottom of the navigation pane.

trans-unit.source: In the pop up dialog, you'll see the storage account name, primary access key and secondary access key.
trans-unit.target: In the pop up dialog, you'll see the storage account name, primary access key and secondary access key.

trans-unit.source: For access key, you can use either the primary one or the secondary one.
trans-unit.target: For access key, you can use either the primary one or the secondary one.

trans-unit.source: The Azure::BlobService object lets you work with containers and blobs.
trans-unit.target: The Azure::BlobService object lets you work with containers and blobs.

trans-unit.source: To create a container, use the create\_container() method.
trans-unit.target: To create a container, use the create\_container() method.

trans-unit.source: The following code example creates a container or print out the error if there is any.
trans-unit.target: The following code example creates a container or print out the error if there is any.

trans-unit.source: If you want to make the files in the container public, you can set the container's permissions.
trans-unit.target: If you want to make the files in the container public, you can set the container's permissions.

trans-unit.source: You can just modify the create\_container() call to pass the :public\_access\_level option:
trans-unit.target: You can just modify the create\_container() call to pass the :public\_access\_level option:

trans-unit.source: Valid values for the :public\_access\_level option are:
trans-unit.target: Valid values for the :public\_access\_level option are:

trans-unit.source: blob: Specifies full public read access for container and blob data.
trans-unit.target: blob: Specifies full public read access for container and blob data.

trans-unit.source: Clients can enumerate blobs within the container via anonymous request, but cannot enumerate containers within the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Clients can enumerate blobs within the container via anonymous request, but cannot enumerate containers within the storage account.

trans-unit.source: container: Specifies public read access for blobs.
trans-unit.target: container: Specifies public read access for blobs.

trans-unit.source: Blob data within this container can be read via anonymous request, but container data is not available.
trans-unit.target: Blob data within this container can be read via anonymous request, but container data is not available.

trans-unit.source: Clients cannot enumerate blobs within the container via anonymous request.
trans-unit.target: Clients cannot enumerate blobs within the container via anonymous request.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can modify the public access level of a container by using set\_container\_acl() method to specify the public access level.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can modify the public access level of a container by using set\_container\_acl() method to specify the public access level.

trans-unit.source: The following code example changes the public access level to container:
trans-unit.target: The following code example changes the public access level to container:

trans-unit.source: To upload content to a blob, use the create\_block\_blob() method to create the blob, use a file or string as the content of the blob.
trans-unit.target: To upload content to a blob, use the create\_block\_blob() method to create the blob, use a file or string as the content of the blob.

trans-unit.source: The following code uploads the file test.png as a new blob named "image-blob" in the container.
trans-unit.target: The following code uploads the file test.png as a new blob named "image-blob" in the container.

trans-unit.source: To list the containers, use list_containers() method.
trans-unit.target: To list the containers, use list_containers() method.

trans-unit.source: To list the blobs within a container, use list\_blobs() method.
trans-unit.target: To list the blobs within a container, use list\_blobs() method.

trans-unit.source: This outputs the urls of all the blobs in all the containers for the account.
trans-unit.target: This outputs the urls of all the blobs in all the containers for the account.

trans-unit.source: To download blobs, use the get\_blob() method to retrieve the contents.
trans-unit.target: To download blobs, use the get\_blob() method to retrieve the contents.

trans-unit.source: The following code example demonstrates using get\_blob() to download the contents of "image-blob" and write it to a local file.
trans-unit.target: The following code example demonstrates using get\_blob() to download the contents of "image-blob" and write it to a local file.

trans-unit.source: Finally, to delete a blob, use the delete\_blob() method.
trans-unit.target: Finally, to delete a blob, use the delete\_blob() method.

trans-unit.source: The following code example demonstrates how to delete a blob.
trans-unit.target: The following code example demonstrates how to delete a blob.
